intro: Consolida sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur-flowered candytuft, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The flowers are borne in racemes and have five petals, with a distinctive saucer-shaped base. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
